text:
Four Seasons Resort The Biltmore Santa Barbara Singled out in andrew harper’s 2015 readers’ choice awards
The results of the 2015 Andrew Harper’s Readers’ Choice Awards represent an unprecedented accomplishment for Four Seasons Resort The Biltmore Santa Barbara – top 12 rankings in four separate categories of the survey of worldwide lodging properties.
The Resort was voted #5 of the Top Beach Resorts in world. Readers also recognised the resort as #12 on the list of Top Spa Resorts in the world. Additionally, the hotel enjoyed recognition as the #9 hotel in the world for Top Family Resorts and was singled out as #6 on the list of Top City Hotels.
“Hotel awards take on additional meaning when they are voted on by the traveling public,” shares General Manager Karen Earp. “We are genuinely humbled to be recognised by returning guests as a high performer in so many categories, particularly given the exceptional quality of service provided globally in the luxury segment today.”
Andrew Harper’s Hideaway Report is the premier digital magazine for sophisticated travellers. Results for the Readers’ Choice Awards are determined from an annual survey where subscribers of Andrew Harper’s Hideaway Report choose their favourite hotel and resort experiences across the categories of US and International Hideaways, Beach, City, Food & Wine, Spa, Golf, Family and Safari Lodges in addition to Cruise Lines. The editorial team at AndewHarper.com describes Four Seasons Resort The Biltmore Santa Barbara as a “Mission-style resort on a 22-acre estate across the street from the public beach. Red tile roofs, lantern-lit brick walkways, courtyard gardens and whitewashed cottages distinguish the 207-room enclave and the Spanish Colonial-style spa features 11 treatment rooms.”
The Resort is located 90 miles north of Los Angeles and is a celebrated location from which to base a visit to the beaches and the cultural and historic treasures of Santa Barbara, including the acclaimed Santa Barbara wine country.
Source:-Four Seasons
